CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 19, 1945, pg. 13 reads: "Pensive - Betty Hall, a student at Pitt seems to be in a deep study here as the photographer passed by and snapped her pictures. This is an excellent example of candid photography.  Anyway, it's a good picture.  Miss Hall is a member of the smart young social set, and does a bit of all right for herself in the way of scholastic records. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Betty Hall wearing dark suit and brooch with "B" initial, posed leaning on stone railing of University of Pittsburgh's Cathedral of Learning
CatSubject_tab: Women--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Portraits--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.University of Pittsburgh.Cathedral of Learning.University of Pittsburgh.Oakland (Pittsburgh, Pa.)Women--Portraits--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.
